info.name: Olfactory bulb & tract
info.description: The olfactory bulb and tract are located on the ventral aspect of the frontal lobes in the olfactory sulcus.  Small-diameter olfactory nerve fibers (CN I) exit the olfactory epithelium, transit the cribriform plate and terminate in the olfactory bulb.  The olfactory tract continues on to the brain where it divides into the lateral and medial stria. The lateral olfactory stria travels across the lateral aspect of the anterior perforated substance and then bends medially toward the uncus.  The medial olfactory stria turns medially behind the paraolfactory area and ends in the subcallosal gyrus.
